meta_description: The Des Moines Art Center is an art museum, a studio arts school, and maintains a world-class sculpture park located in Des Moines, Iowa.
hours_text:
## Learn, enjoy, socialize, and create with us! The Des Moines Art Center is a museum, art school, and sculpture park in the capital city of Iowa that is open to all.

Established in 1948, the Des Moines Art Center exists to engage and stimulate the communities of Greater Des Moines and beyond. We are home to an exceptional [collection of art](https://emuseum.desmoinesartcenter.org/objects/images) made between 1500 and the present day. We offer free [exhibitions](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/art/exhibitions/), [events and programs](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/calendar/), [tours](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/visit/tours/), and [lectures](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/art/resources/category/webcasts/) at our main campus in Greenwood Park, consisting of [three unique buildings](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/about/architecture/) designed by world renowned architects Eliel Saarinen, I. M. Pei, and Richard Meier.

The Des Moines Art Center oversees the iconic [John and Mary Pappajohn Sculpture Park](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/visit/pappajohn-sculpture-park/) in Western Gateway Park, which opened in 2009. We also provides dozens of [art classes](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/classes/) for kids, teens, and adults at the Art Center and around the Des Moines community.

[ARCHITECTURE GUIDE](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Architecture-Guide_single-pages_web.pdf)

[visitor map](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Art-Center_v...

accessibility_text:
### Accessible Guided Tours

We offer a variety of accessible tours based on individual needs at both the museum and the Pappajohn Sculpture Park. Email [tours@desmoinesartcenter.org](mailto:tours@desmoinesartcenter.org) to schedule an accessible guided tour. Please allow two weeks notice to schedule a tour.

### Accessible Guided Tours

We offer a variety of accessible tours based on individual needs at both the museum and the Pappajohn Sculpture Park. Email [tours@desmoinesartcenter.org](mailto:tours@desmoinesartcenter.org) to schedule an accessible guided tour. Please allow two weeks notice to schedule a tour.

### Accessible Guided Tours

We offer a variety of accessible tours based on individual needs at both the museum and the Pappajohn Sculpture Park. Email [tours@desmoinesartcenter.org](mailto:tours@desmoinesartcenter.org) to schedule an accessible guided tour. Please allow two weeks notice to schedule a tour.

##### Register soon

## Summer Camp

Art camps are offered in a variety of themes and mediums for youth ages 5 – 14 all summer long. Registration opens January 2, 2026, for members and January 12, 2026, for non-members.

[Learn More](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/camp/)

##### Explore The Park

## Pappajohn Sculpture Park

The John and Mary Pappajohn Sculpture Park features artwork by more than two dozen of the world’s most celebrated artists. This accessible setting, coupled with the skilled landscape design and caliber of the art, makes it unlike any other sculpture park in the United States.

[Plan your visit](https://desmoinesartcenter.org/visit/pappajohn-sculpture-park/)
